en.window_title: Sid Game Tools v1.0.5 - Health Monitor + Auto Clear Inventory + Automation Tools
en.adjust_interface_ui_title: ğŸ–¼ï¸ Adjust Interface UI Detection Parameters
en.red_hsv_explanation:
ğŸ”´ Red HSV Parameters control low health red pixel detection sensitivity
â€¢ Saturation: Lower value = detect darker red, Higher value = detect only vivid red
â€¢ Brightness: Lower value = detect darker red, Higher value = detect only bright red
â€¢ Recommended range: Saturation 50-150, Brightness 50-150
â€¢ Used for: Adapting to different game screen brightness and contrast
en.green_hsv_explanation:
ğŸŸ¢ Green HSV Parameters control healthy state green pixel detection sensitivity
â€¢ Saturation: Lower value = detect darker green, Higher value = detect only vivid green
â€¢ Brightness: Lower value = detect darker green, Higher value = detect only bright green
â€¢ Recommended range: Saturation 50-150, Brightness 50-150
â€¢ Used for: Adapting to different game screen brightness and contrast
en.ssim_explanation:
ğŸ“Š SSIM (Image Similarity) evaluates overall structural similarity of images
â€¢ Closer to 1.0 = stricter detection (accepts only highly similar images)
â€¢ Closer to 0.0 = looser detection (allows more structural variation)
â€¢ Recommended range: 0.85-0.95 (balance flexibility and accuracy)
â€¢ Used for: Detecting UI element position and layout changes
en.histogram_explanation:
ğŸ“ˆ Color Distribution Similarity compares color distribution features of images
â€¢ Closer to 1.0 = stricter detection (requires highly similar color distribution)
â€¢ Closer to 0.0 = looser detection (allows larger color distribution differences)
â€¢ Recommended range: 0.90-0.98 (suitable for most UI detection scenarios)
â€¢ Used for: Detecting overall color style and brightness changes
en.color_diff_explanation:
ğŸ¨ Color Difference measures average difference of RGB color channels
â€¢ Smaller value = stricter detection (requires highly similar colors)
â€¢ Larger value = looser detection (allows greater color variation)
â€¢ Recommended range: 20-60 (adjust based on image quality and lighting conditions)
â€¢ Used for: Detecting subtle color changes or lighting differences
en.reset_completed_message: Reset to default values, please click 'Apply Settings' to save
en.red_h_range_error: Red H range must be between 0-20
en.green_h_range_error: Green H range must be between 30-90
en.red_saturation_range_error: Red minimum saturation must be between 50-255
en.red_value_range_error: Red minimum brightness must be between 50-255
en.green_saturation_range_error: Green minimum saturation must be between 50-255
en.green_value_range_error: Green minimum brightness must be between 50-255
en.color_threshold_empty: Color difference threshold cannot be empty
en.mse_invalid_number: MSE threshold must be a valid number
en.ssim_invalid_number: SSIM threshold must be a valid number
en.histogram_invalid_number: Histogram threshold must be a valid number
en.color_invalid_number: Color difference threshold must be a valid number
en.color_range_error: Color difference threshold must be between 5-100
en.health_pixel_ratio_explanation:
ğŸ¥ Health Pixel Ratio Threshold determines the sensitivity of regional health color detection
â€¢ Closer to 1.0 = stricter detection (region needs more health color to be considered "has health")
â€¢ Closer to 0.0 = looser detection (region only needs a small amount of health color to be considered "has health")
â€¢ Recommended range: 0.2-0.5 (adjust based on health bar design and game)
â€¢ Used for: determining whether each small area of the health bar contains health color
en.red_h_range_explanation:
ğŸ”´ Red H Range (Color Type) defines the maximum upper limit of red color range
â€¢ Smaller value = narrower red color range (detects only specific red), more precise detection
â€¢ Larger value = wider red color range, includes more red color variations
â€¢ Recommended range: 0-20 (standard red range)
â€¢ Used for: red health bar detection when health is low
en.green_h_range_explanation:
ğŸŸ¢ Green H Range (Color Type) defines the green color range when health bar is healthy
â€¢ Smaller value = detects yellowish green tones
â€¢ Larger value = detects bluish green tones
â€¢ Recommended range: 30-90 (standard green range)
â€¢ Used for: green health bar detection when in healthy state

en.health_monitor_desc:
â€¢ Real-time monitoring of health and mana bars
â€¢ Custom trigger percentage thresholds
â€¢ Automatic execution of set hotkeys
â€¢ Support for cooldown control
en.smart_inventory_desc:
â€¢ One-click clear all inventory items
â€¢ Record inventory UI reference colors
â€¢ Right-click for 2 seconds to emergency interrupt
â€¢ Support for any inventory size
en.skill_combo_desc:
â€¢ Set trigger keys and skill sequences
â€¢ Support 1-5 skill combos
â€¢ Adjustable delay time
â€¢ Enable multiple sets simultaneously
en.automation_tools_desc:
â€¢ F6 one-click pickup (5 coordinates)
â€¢ CTRL+Left click auto rapid click
â€¢ F5 quick return to hideout
â€¢ Global pause function
en.version_info_text:

en.quickstart_text:
âš¡ 3-Minute Quick Setup:

1ï¸ Select game window
2ï¸ Select health bar region
3ï¸ Set trigger conditions
4ï¸ Start monitoring system

ğŸ® Start enjoying automated gaming experience!
en.setup_guide_text:
ğŸ”§ Health Monitor Setup:
1. Select game window
2. Click "Select Health Bar"
3. Drag to select health bar region
4. Set trigger conditions
5. Start monitoring

ğŸ“¦ Clear Inventory Setup:
1. Click "Select Inventory UI"
2. Select inventory region
3. Record empty color reference
4. Use F3 to start clearing

âš™ï¸ Combo System Setup:
1. Select trigger key
2. Set skill sequence
3. Adjust delay time
4. Enable required sets
en.notes_text:
â€¢ Ensure the game window is in the foreground for best function performance
â€¢ Please select regions precisely to avoid interference elements
â€¢ It is recommended to test settings in a safe environment
â€¢ Skill combo delay is recommended to be set between 300-1000 milliseconds
â€¢ All settings will be automatically saved and loaded on next startup
â€¢ This tool is completely open source and free, do not purchase if you encounter paid versions
â€¢ If you encounter problems during use, please submit an Issue on GitHub
en.license_text: GNU AGPL v3 - Completely Free and Open Source

en.disclaimer_text:
This software is free and open source. If you were charged for it, please request an immediate refund. Please visit GitHub to download the latest official version.

This software is for personal use only, intended for learning Python programming, computer vision, UI automation and other technologies. Do not use it for any commercial or profit-making purposes.

Using this software may result in account bans. Please use it after understanding the risks.

en.skill_combo_usage_content:
1. Set trigger skill: Select a key as the combo trigger key
2. Set combo skills: Select 1-5 skill keys as combo sequence
3. Set delay time: Delay time between each combo (milliseconds)
4. Enable set: Check sets to use
5. Start system: Click "Start Combo System" to start monitoring trigger key

ğŸ’¡ Tips:
â€¢ Supported keys: QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJKLZXCVBNM1234567890
â€¢ Delay time suggestion: 100-500 milliseconds
â€¢ Multiple sets can be enabled simultaneously
â€¢ System runs in background without affecting other operations

âš ï¸ Important Notes:
â€¢ Trigger key will be sent to both game and combo function
â€¢ If "Stationary Attack" is checked, skills will be executed as Shift+Skill
â€¢ Using trigger key in game chat will input English letters, which cannot be avoided
â€¢ It is recommended to use F9 pause function during chat to avoid accidental triggering

3. Set the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th positions in sequence
4. Auto-save after setup completion and ready for testing

en.mse_explanation:
MSE (Mean Squared Error) measures the average pixel difference of images
â€¢ Smaller value = stricter detection (requires highly similar pixels)
â€¢ Larger value = looser detection (allows greater pixel differences)
â€¢ Recommended range: 100-2000 (adjust based on image quality)
â€¢ Used for: detecting subtle pixel changes
